New Records: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer when his team was trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all postseason game
Key Match Events: Jake Bauers and Sal Frelick opened the seventh inning with back-to-back homers
Francisco Lindor worked an eight-pitch walk, Mark Vientos singled sharply, and Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer to give New York the lead
Jesse Winker was hit by a pitch, stole second, and scored on Starling Marte’s single to right
Brice Turang hit into a double play to end the series
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed excitement to help keep the team alive
Pat Murphy expressed love for the team and disappointment with the loss
Francisco Lindor praised Pete Alonso’s home run
Joey Ortiz struck out, and Brice Turang hit into a double play to end the series
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Brewers appeared to have the victory in hand after Jake Bauers and Sal Frelick hit back-to-back homers in the seventh inning
New York Mets advanced in the playoffs for the first time since winning the 2015 National League pennant
This was the first postseason meeting between the heated rivals
Others: The Brewers still haven't won a postseason series since reaching Game 7 of the 2018 National League Championship Series
